description: Compulsory 3-day field trip with team data collection, followed by individual analysis and submission of a 20+ page report describing landforms, processes, and environmental changes. Includes critical review of theories and management context.
2-hour exam with extended response questions covering all course topics, including comparisons of physical environments and evaluation of factors/processes in different settings.

Three individual lab reports (15% each) involving aerial imagery interpretation, topographic surveying, sediment/soil analysis, hydrologic data evaluation, and field data interpretation. Submitted in weeks 2, 7, and 10.
